situation: S was upset and crying in the classroom after hearing loud noises from construction work outside. The noises triggered her anxiety and she seemed overwhelmed.
action: The teacher aide calmly approached S and guided her to the quiet area of the classroom, offering noise-canceling headphones to help her feel more comfortable. The aide then offered S a breathing exercise to help calm her nerves.
effect: S gradually calmed down with the headphones and breathing exercise, feeling more secure and able to return to her schoolwork after a period of relaxation. The approach was sensitive and effectively minimized S's distress.
